body_html:
Great job! Consider squashing the commits before merging.

As for _all_functions, it looks to me it's independent from from .fold import *.
It's used here:
https://github.com/jbarker-nvidia/pytorch/blob/im2col/torch/nn/backends/thnn.py
to allow the backend to register all thnn functions automatically, so that look them up as an attribute of the backend object (see https://github.com/jbarker-nvidia/pytorch/blob/im2col/torch/nn/backends/backend.py).

I'm working on another PR at the moment - I'm not sure what is failing if you include _all_functions in fold.py. What's the error there?

to allow the backend to register all thnn functions automatically, so that look them up as an attribute of the backend object (see https://github.com/jbarker-nvidia/pytorch/blob/im2col/torch/nn/backends/backend.py).

body:
Great job! Consider squashing the commits before merging.

As for `_all_functions`, it looks to me it's independent from `from .fold import *`.
It's used here:
https://github.com/jbarker-nvidia/pytorch/blob/im2col/torch/nn/backends/thnn.py
to allow the backend to register all thnn functions automatically, so that look them up as an attribute of the backend object (see https://github.com/jbarker-nvidia/pytorch/blob/im2col/torch/nn/backends/backend.py).

I'm working on another PR at the moment - I'm not sure what is failing if you include `_all_functions` in `fold.py`. What's the error there?
